alert.note: Alert for Benton (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 09 at 8:38PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Benton, central Rogers, southeastern Osage, Mayes, northwestern Adair, northern Cherokee, southeastern Pawnee, Tulsa, southeastern Craig, Delaware, southeastern Ottawa, Creek, Wagoner, northern Okmulgee and northwestern Muskogee Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 837 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a broken line of showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from near Wheaton to 2 miles south of Chloeta to 2 miles southwest of Catoosa to near Jennings. An outflow boundary was surging south well ahead of the storms. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Rogers... Muskogee... Bentonville... Sand Springs... Claremore... Tahlequah... Siloam Springs... Wagoner... Bristow... Jay... Pryor... Owasso... Bella Vista... Bixby... Sapulpa... Jenks... Glenpool... Coweta... This includes the following highways, Interstate 44 between mile markers 179 and 277. Interstate 49 between mile markers 80 and 93. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
